Photo Tip: To take the perfect picture of the Northern Lights, shoot in RAW format, set LCD Brightness to low, remove the filter from your lens, and pre-focus your lens on infinity or use live-view with loupe.

Photo Tip: To ensure your flower shots are sharp where you want, try switching your camera to manual focus and doing it yourself. Changing focus alters the magnification of the subject, and helps get the sweet spot of sharpness where you want it. How often do you use manual focus when taking photos?

Photo Tip: When taking pictures through glass, use a polarizing filter. If you want some reflections, watch carefully through the lens as you rotate the polarizing filter, and turn it to just the point that satisfies you. 
What tips do you have for taking photos through glass?

Happy Independence Day! Want to take the perfect 4th of July fireworks photo? Make sure you use a tripod to keep it steady! You’ll be using longer shutter speeds which will not only capture movement of the fireworks, but any other movement of the camera itself.

Ready for a fantastic 4th of July weekend? Post your best photo of your weekend festivities below in the comments for for a chance to win a Toshiba FlashAir™ Wireless SD card! Contest ends 07/04/16, 11:59pm. Must be 18+ and live in U.S.
